Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction
Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction

result.execSummary:
The defendant Dillon D Guerra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.
  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Misdemeanor Conviction, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction
Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 39 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 4 and Case 13CF909.

AMENDED 04-03-2015:  Probation term amended to 2 years which is the maximum term.
Concurrent with: Count 4 and Case 13CF909.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to court costs.  PAID IN FULL.  DNA surcharge is waived.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
Defendant needs to be working toward his High School Diploma.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Anger Managment or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through if deemed appropriate by Agent.
No contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint (court will allow Agent to modify if deemed appropriate or Court order out of family court).

Case 14CF631 was dismissed and read in.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours (Huber) with Standard Release Conditions, commencing forthwith.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Timothy Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Dillon D Guerra in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail) with attorney Eryn M Menden.  

Defendant enters pleas of Guilty to counts 3 & 4.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of counts 3 & 4.
Counts 1 & 2 are dismissed as read ins.
Defendant presented statements to the court.



Court orders the following:
Count 3:
150 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
39 Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  Case 13CF909 and Count 4.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 3 Years.
Concurrent to:  Count 4 and Case 13CF909.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and Follow Through if deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling .
Defendant needs to be working toward his High School 
No contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint (court will allow agent to modify if deemed appropriate or court order out of family court).
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Costs: $243
DNA Surcharge:  $200
Apply Bail to case 13CF909 then to counts 3 & 4 and Refund Balance to the Posting Party.

Condition Time:
20 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
Forthwith.





Count 4:
150 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time
39  Days Credit.
Concurrent to:  Case 13CF909 and Count 4.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 3 Years.
Concurrent to:  Count 3 and Case 13CF909.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as Count 3.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
Apply Bail to case 13CF909 then counts 3 & 4 and Refund Balance to the Posting Party.
